page.title: 18GRASS-TRACKING
page.content:
Darley Moor grass tracking is held every fortnight on a Sunday. Some of the car racers come from Melton, Nottingham, North Wales and North Yorkshire. On the Saturday before they race, they fill in some of the holes in the track. Some of the races are the special race and the junior race.
Darley Moor used to be an old wartime airfield. It is good for racing because it is flat.
A grass tracker is a car bodywork and a homemade engine. The cars race round the track about five times. Sometimes the cars roll over or crash.
